availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania
Crawford Co } SS

I John O Neill having been appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner within and for the State of Pennsylvania to administer oaths and take depositions and affidavits to be used in said State of Kentucky and the acknowledgement of Deeds and other Instruments of Writing to be used or Recorded in said State of Kentucky do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner as prescribed by the laws of said State. So help me God

On this 10th day of November 1865 personally appeared before me the above mentioned John O Neill and took and subscribed to the foregoing oath
Joel N Angier Notary Public

figure.ab:
JOEL N ANGIER NOTARY PUBLIC TITUSVILLE
CRAWFORD CO, PA

body.p:
Comr of Deeds
Pennsylvania
Oath of John O Neill
filed 17 Nov/65
